title.en: The Way, the Truth, and the Life

en: As the time drew near for Jesus to leave them,
he spoke words of comfort to his disciples.

label.en: Do Not Let Your Hearts Be Troubled

lines: Jesus said,
“Do not let your hearts be troubled.
Trust in God; trust also in me.
In my Father’s house are many rooms.
I am going there to prepare a place for you.
And I will come back
and take you to be with me.”
Thomas said,
“Lord, we do not know where you are going.
How can we know the way?”
Jesus answered,
“I am the way
and the truth
and the life.
No one comes to the Father
except through me.”
Jesus said,
“If you love me, you will obey my commands.
I will ask the Father,
and he will give you another Counselor,
the Spirit of truth,
to be with you forever.
He will teach you all things
and remind you of everything I have said.”

question.en: Jesus says he is the way to the Father. What do you think he means? Why does he connect trust in God with trust in himself?
